messages.subject: Re: Choosing our fate (was astrology and tarot)
messages.msgSnippet: Skepticism gets a bad reputation ;-) It gets equated with being closed minded. ***Believe me, being open-minded and positive gets a bad rep too!  (I can t tell
messages.messageBody:
Skepticism gets a bad reputation ;-) It gets equated
with being closed
minded.

***Believe me, being open-minded and positive gets a
bad rep too! (I can't tell you the number of times
I've been called naive :-) ) (Not that I'm at all
calling you closed-minded, I'm just saying that people
will probably criticize no matter which way you
approach things.)

Well, I'm not going to quote the rest of your e-mail,
but I think we are actually pretty much on the same
page... I'm not suggesting any sort of blind faith in
things that are completely unproven... just that we
trust our insticts and if there are ideas out there
that really hit home with us on an instinctual level
then we shouldn't be afraid to trust that. (Whether we
can prove them 'rationally' or not.)

Love, Tori


=====
Tori Kirkby
Creative spirit and mom to Jade (3 1/2) and mystery baby due any day now!

The basis of life is Freedom
The objective of life is Joy
The result of life is Growth
- Abraham, 1989
